runs.comm: good start, nippy length ball on off stump, defended
flails at  one leaving him with the angle and misses
rips a cut which falls short of backward point
that took off, really did, no need to duck under to avoid it

edged, and gone, McClenaghan strikes in his first over in international cricket, Levi did not look comfortable, another one angled across, he pushes tentatively at it, away from the body, thick edge carries safely to first slip
angles another one across the right-hander, who lets it go
bowled from wide of the crease, way down the leg side, a mile and three
fine delivery, angled in just outside off stump, he comes forward, pushes outside the line as it seams in, half an appeal for caught behind
punched from the crease to cover
confident shout for lbw, too much angle on the length delivery, though, looked to be sliding just down leg, replays show it just clipping leg
a charge, a heave and a thick inside edge down to the fine leg rope
punches solidly off the back foot to extra cover
he's looked in control when he plays from the crease, stands and thumps a back of a length ball high over extra cover
138.6 kph and rising on the batsman, who moves across, gets behind the line and blocks
that's pinged him close to the elbow and gone on the bounce to the keeper, Faf left feeling his elbow after moving forward to defend, it moved back in just enough to trouble him
leading edge now, he looks sharp does McClenaghan, Faf trying to work a pitched up ball to leg
short and down the pads now, swung away to fine leg, not timed at all
thick inside edge as he pushes forward with an angled bat, the length ball races behind square leg
just out of the reach of mid on running back, Faf does not get hold of the lofted stroke down the ground to a full delivery, gets too much height on it, but falls safely in the end
South Africa getting away with some aggression, he makes room and tries to loft over extra cover, thick outside edge flies over the deep backward point rope
full, flicked away, off the pads, to deep square
comes outside the crease and defends a back of a length ball

they get another one away, not exactly in total control, but much better than Faf's previous attempt, walks out and across the pitch and picks a full delivery in the air and down the ground, mid on can't pull it back
short, pulled away confidently to deep square
too wide, and slapped over cover, fielder gives chase, dives and ends up palming it into the rope, not New Zealand's night at all
forward to defend a pitched up ball to the off side
surprised by the bounce from a good length, takes a hand off the bat as he defends

oh dear, that has gone through mid on, Anderson it is, driven down the ground, fielder gets across and has enough time to bend down and get his body behind the ball, but it eludes him and runs away for four
short, swatted disdainfully, from outside off, and one bounce into the deep square leg rope
Faf ending whatever NZ hopes remained, lofts over extra cover now, one-bounce-four again
moves across to a skiddy length ball and works it to square leg
they continue to go down the ground, down the track, not quite to the pitch, goes through with the swing and lofts it between bowler and mid on
gone this time, Hira bowling it slower, tossing it up, Davids advances out again, trying to go over mid off/extra cover, misses, and is bowled
yet another misfield from NZ, at extra cover, as de Kock slaps a length ball away
pushes back to the bowler
fuller and defended off the front foot
very full, almost in the blockhole, eased down the pitch, mid off gets to it
NZ favoured the pull, SA going for the lofted stroke down the ground, de Kock this time, taking a step out and sending a length ball over mid off
short, pulled, without much timing, Franklin scrambles to his left at mid on to stop ot
Faf pulls a good length ball, something that didn;t work for NZ, they settle for a single to midwicket in the end
he looked playing this one, some width outside off, and he instantly slams it past short cover
sitting up from back of a length, pulled in the air over the infield, man in the deep at square leg somehow manages to cut it off with a tumble
slow length ball spinning away a bit, hit to extra cover
angled in full, he gets around it to drive to extra cover
that turned, sharply, bounced too, almost hit it straight to extra cover
good bowling, this one hurries in with the angle, de Kock trying to cut, cannot place it past point
finds the fielder once again with the cut
this time he beats the dive at point, and will get another boundary
skids into the pads and is worked to deep square
swatted away, but cannot get it past extra cover who runs to his left to field
getting a bit impatient, moves away and cuts to short third man
more impatience, backs away to leg but Hira follows him and he finds no timing at all on the swing
punched down to long on with the spin
makes some room but cannot place it past the off side infield
into the pads, and eased through midwicket
pushed back to the bowler
off the front foot, back to the bowler again
nudged with the turn in front of square leg
through the covers for another four, flighted outside off, Faf to the pitch and gracefully putting it away
he has repeatedly kept going for the cut, this time he under-edges it, but it was too low for McCullum, he can't get down to it, chance anyway
down the track, it is fired in full, Faf recovers to work it through midwicket
whipped off the pads, and it almost beats the man running across from deep square leg, parries it away almost off the ropes
nudged to short fine leg
whipped to deep square leg
lovely stroke, de Kock has played a few, strides forward and lofts powerfully over extra cover, a bounce before it goes over the ropes
intentionally cut in the air over backward point and short third man, top placement
false stroke now through midwicket
down to long on for a single
and that was it, Faf du Plessis wins his first match as South Africa captain with a crisp drive that beats point and is too far from third man to stop the two that SA need
